articles.headline: Labor Board Official Backs Union Challenge on Amazon Vote
articles.snippet: A hearing officer for the National Labor Relations Board found that Amazon illegally discouraged organizing at an Alabama warehouse. The company can appeal to block a new election.
articles.abstract: A hearing officer for the National Labor Relations Board found that Amazon illegally discouraged organizing at an Alabama warehouse. The company can appeal to block a new election.
articles.lead_paragraph: A hearing officer of the National Labor Relations Board has recommended that the board throw out a union election at an Amazon warehouse in Bessemer, Ala., where results announced in early April showed workers rejecting a union by a more than two-to-one ratio.

articles.headline: Americans Suffer Pandemic Whiplash as Leaders Struggle With Changing Virus
articles.snippet: An evolving virus and 18 months of ever-changing pandemic messaging have left Americans angry, exhausted and skeptical of public health advice.
articles.abstract: An evolving virus and 18 months of ever-changing pandemic messaging have left Americans angry, exhausted and skeptical of public health advice.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A week of public health reversals from the White House and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has left Americans with pandemic whiplash, sowing confusion about coronavirus vaccines and mask-wearing as the Delta variant upends what people thought they knew about how to stay safe.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: What’s in the $1 Trillion Infrastructure Bill
articles.snippet: The sprawling, 2,702-page bill includes historic investments in traditional projects as well as broadband expansion and funds for some climate projects.
articles.abstract: The sprawling, 2,702-page bill includes historic investments in traditional projects as well as broadband expansion and funds for some climate projects.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Amtrak would see its biggest infusion of money since its inception a half-century ago. Climate resilience programs would receive their largest burst of government spending ever. The nation’s power grid would be upgraded to the tune of $73 billion.
articles.byline: By Emily Cochrane, Christopher Flavelle and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Big Economic Challenges Await Biden and the Fed This Fall
articles.snippet: Expiring unemployment benefits and the Delta variant add uncertainty to a recovery that has brought strong growth but an unusual labor market.
articles.abstract: Expiring unemployment benefits and the Delta variant add uncertainty to a recovery that has brought strong growth but an unusual labor market.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The U.S. economy is heading toward an increasingly uncertain autumn as a surge in the Delta variant of the coronavirus coincides with the expiration of expanded unemployment benefits for millions of people, complicating what was supposed to be a return to normal as a wave of workers re-entered the labor market.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: What if Highways Were Electric? Germany Is Testing the Idea.
articles.snippet: An electrified highway is theoretically the most efficient way to eliminate truck emissions. But the political obstacles are daunting.
articles.abstract: An electrified highway is theoretically the most efficient way to eliminate truck emissions. But the political obstacles are daunting.
articles.lead_paragraph: OBER-RAMSTADT, Germany — On a highway south of Frankfurt recently, Thomas Schmieder maneuvered his Scania tractor-trailer and its load of house paint into the far right lane. Then he flicked a switch you won’t find on most truck dashboards.

articles.headline: The Biden administration issues a new eviction moratorium as the virus surges.
articles.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said it would impose a 60-day ban on evictions in places hit hard by the Delta variant.
articles.abstract: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said it would impose a 60-day ban on evictions in places hit hard by the Delta variant.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration on Tuesday imposed a new, 60-day federal moratorium on evictions in areas of the country ravaged by the Delta variant, a move aimed at protecting hundreds of thousands of renters at risk of being kicked out of their homes during a pandemic.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Michael D. Shear and Alan Rappeport
